alert.note: Alert for Iowa; Lafayette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 14 at 8:19AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Iowa and Lafayette. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Parts of Dodgeville currently seeing some minor flooding in ditches and low lying areas according to observers in that location. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dodgeville, Mineral Point, Barneveld, Arena, Ridgeway, Linden, Cobb, Rewey, Governor Dodge St Park, Edmund, London, Blue Mound St Park and Platte Mounds. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
